French PM Bayrou's strategy comes under fire ahead of confidence vote
subhead: François Bayrou continues to bank on education and a public opinion shift to convince lawmakers before the September 8 confidence vote. While he'll hold meetings with party leaders starting September 1, he has made no announcements or outlined any specific avenues for compromise.

title: In Moldova, Macron condemns Kremlin 'lies' and 'propaganda' ahead of parliamentary elections
subhead: The French president, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk traveled to Moldova on Wednesday to celebrate the anniversary of the country's independence ahead of the September 28 elections, as pro-European President Maia Sandu risks losing her absolute majority.

title: After Minneapolis shooting, Trump's supporters charge 'trans-terrorism'
subhead: Two children were killed and 17 others wounded on Wednesday, August 27, by Robin Westman, a 23-year-old who legally purchased three different firearms.

title: Will France's government collapse? Do the math with our simulator
subhead: To survive the confidence vote on September 8, Prime Minister François Bayrou must secure a majority of votes cast in the Assemblée Nationale. Abstentions and absences will not be counted.

Mohammed VI, a king with big foreign policy plans
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (4/6). In recent years, the Moroccan monarch has become highly active on the international stage. From the highly sensitive issue of Western Sahara to Morocco's rapprochement with Israel, he has often established himself as the central player.

title: At the Venice Film Festival, French filmmakers take on literary adaptation
subhead: Valérie Donzelli, François Ozon, Cédric Jimenez and Olivier Assayas are all presenting films adapted from novels at the Mostra, running from August 27 to September 6.

title: Life in the West Bank settlement of Kedem Arava: 'We're not taking anyone's place, there is only sand around us'
subhead: Established in 2017 near the Jordanian border, the Kedem Arava settlement contains prefabricated homes housing some 60 families, former city dwellers seeking a life closer to nature. While most residents deny ideological motivation, their presence fully aligns with the annexation of Palestinian territory sought by the Israeli far right.
